articles.title: Champions League permutations - what do Chelsea, Arsenal & Man Utd need?
articles.summary: BBC Sport assesses how Arsenal, Chelsea and Man Utd have fared so far in this season's Women's Champions League with one league phase round remaining.

articles.title: Amorim has fans back onside - but now faces fresh problems
articles.summary: Ruben Amorim got Manchester United fans back onside with tactical flexibility against Bournemouth, but AFCON absences raise new problems, writes Dan Khan...

articles.title: Five clubs in Semenyo chase - Wednesday's gossip
articles.summary: Five Premier League clubs in the frame to sign Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo, Everton interested in Middlesbrough's Hayden Hackney, Aston Villa plan Youri Tielemans contract talks, plus more.

articles.title: Ex-Celtic boss Rodgers named manager of Saudi side
articles.summary: Brendan Rodgers is the new manager of Saudi club Al-Qadsiah after leaving Celtic in October.

articles.title: 'Very strict' sanctions needed in Turkish betting scandal
articles.summary: The response to the Turkish football betting scandal must have the same cultural impact as the punishments for the Calciopoli affair in Italy, says the assistant manager of Galatasaray.

articles.title: Nancy 'grateful' for Celtic backing amid losing start
articles.summary: Wilfried Nancy says "I don't have to prove anything to anybody" amid criticism of his losing start as Celtic manager.

articles.title: Lewandowski in Chicago Fire talks over MLS move
articles.summary: Chicago Fire are in pole position to sign Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski in the summer on a free transfer.

articles.title: A 'throwback' to Man Utd's past, defensive chaos and a classic
articles.summary: A remarkable, chaotic, mesmerising Premier League thriller at Old Trafford between Manchester United and Bournemouth captures the imagination of all those present - even the two head coaches.

articles.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?

articles.title: Footballer who fled Taliban hopes to become 'Pakistani Haaland'
articles.summary: Umar Nawaz turned to football to help him adjust to life in the UK - now he's representing his country.

articles.title: Visually impaired Palace fan makes commentary history
articles.summary: Crystal Palace fan Neale Ormston becomes first visually impaired person to commentate on a Premier League game using a specially made headset.

articles.title: Hamilton docked nine more points after rule breach

articles.title: Where does Old Trafford thriller rank among best Premier League games?
articles.summary: Manchester United and Bournemouth played out a rollercoaster 4-4 draw at Old Trafford on Monday. But where does it rank among the greatest games in Premier League history?

articles.title: Morgan sold to San Diego by New York Red Bulls
articles.summary: San Diego buy Lewis Morgan from Major Soccer League rivals New York Red Bulls, with the Scotland winger saying "it is tought to say bye" to the club where he has spent four seasons.
